enum.name: ReplicaSetMemberStatus
enum.comment:
Status for the member of the replica set managed by this instance.
Confer https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/replica-states/ for the MongoDB documentation about replica states.
enum.item: The status has not yet been determined.
Member is the primary of the replica set. (MongoDB PRIMARY replica state)
Member is a secondary of the replica set. (MongoDB SECONDARY replica state)
Member acts as an arbiter of the replica set, i.e., it participates in leader elections to break ties but does not replicate data itself. (MongoDB ARBITER replica state)
The instance is up but has not received a replica set configuration, yet. We expect to join or initiate a cluster soon. (mongo-cxx-driver exception with code NotYetInitialized)
The replica set is currently initializing, e.g., performing the initial data synchronization. (MongoDB replica states RECOVERING, STARTUP2, and ROLLBACK)

The cluster has an invalid configuration. This requires manual intervention, the cluster cannot recover automatically.
(mongo-cxx-driver exceptoin with code InvalidReplicaSetConfig)

The replica set configuration does not mention this instance. Seems we have been removed. It is unlikely this node will join again without intervention. (local instance not found in member list at all)
There has been an error when handling the result, most likely caused by an unknown replica state (for a new MongoDB version).

enum.name: ReplicaSetPrimaryStatus
enum.comment: Status of the replica set with regard to a primary.
enum.item: Fetching the status failed and we do not know the status regarding a primary of.
The replica set does have a primary.
The replica set currently has no primary. We are going to initiate a leader election shortly.

data.comment: MongoDB Managed Replica Set Statis. The mongodb plugin can manage replica sets, i.e., it can bootstrap them for initial setup and add and remove replica set members dynamically. This interface provides status information.
data.field: The current status of the managed member of the replica set.
Status of the replica set regarding a primary.
A message describing an error in more detail.
